metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39320 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP may attempt integer addition on too narrow types leads to allocation of a buffer too small holding the data written. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> malicious server could cause client to crash

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4').
